greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: A(n,k) = exponent of the largest power of n-th prime which divides the product of the elements on row (k-1) of Pascal's triangle; a square array read by antidiagonals.
comment: Square array A(n,k), where n = row, k = column, read by antidiagonals: A(1,1), A(1,2), A(2,1), A(1,3), A(2,2), A(3,1), ....
A(n,k) is A000040(n)-adic valuation of A001142(k-1).
link: Jeffrey C. Lagarias, Harsh Mehta, Products of binomial coefficients and unreduced Farey fractions, arXiv:1409.4145 [math.NT], 2014.
example: The top left corner of the array:
program: (define (A249421bi row col) (A249344bi row (A001142 (- col 1)))) ;; Code for A249344bi given in A249344.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Oct 28 2014
